IntersectionObserverEntry.summary: The IntersectionObserverEntry interface of the Intersection Observer API describes the intersection between the target element and its root container at a specific moment of transition.

remarks.para: Instances of IntersectionObserverEntry are delivered to an callback in its entries parameter; otherwise, these objects can only be obtained by calling .

IntersectionObserverEntryTarget.summary: The target read-only property of the interface indicates which targeted has changed its amount of intersection with the intersection root.
IntersectionObserverEntryTarget.value: The IntersectionObserverEntry's target property specifies which previously targeted by calling experienced a change in intersection with the root.

IntersectionObserverEntryIntersectionRat.summary: The intersectionRatio read-only property of the interface tells you how much of the target element is currently visible within the root's intersection ratio, as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
IntersectionObserverEntryIntersectionRat.value:
A number between 0.0 and 1.0 which indicates how much of the target element is actually visible within the root's intersection rectangle.
More precisely, this value is the ratio of the area of the intersection rectangle () to the area of the target's bounds rectangle ().If the area of the target's bounds rectangle is zero, the returned value is 1 if is true or 0 if not.

IntersectionObserverEntryRootBounds.summary: The rootBounds read-only property of the interface is a corresponding to the 's root intersection rectangle, offset by the if one is specified.
IntersectionObserverEntryRootBounds.value:
A which describes the root intersection rectangle.
For roots which are the 's viewport, this rectangle is the bounds rectangle of the entire document.
Otherwise, it's the bounds of the root element.This rectangle is offset by the values in .

IntersectionObserverEntryTime.summary: The time read-only property of the interface is a that indicates the time at which the intersection change occurred relative to the time at which the document was created.
IntersectionObserverEntryTime.value:
A which indicates the time at which the element experienced the
intersection change described by the IntersectionObserverEntry.
The time is specified in milliseconds since the creation of the containing document.

IntersectionObserverEntryBoundingClientR.summary: The boundingClientRect read-only property of the interface returns a which in essence describes a rectangle describing the smallest rectangle that contains the entire target element.
IntersectionObserverEntryBoundingClientR.value:
A which describes the smallest rectangle that contains every part of the target element whose intersection change is being described.
This value is obtained using the same algorithm as , so refer to that article for details on precisely what is done to obtain this rectangle and what is and is not included within its bounds.In the general case, however, it's safe to think of this as the bounds rectangle of the target element.

IntersectionObserverEntryIntersectionRec.summary: The intersectionRect read-only property of the interface is a object which describes the smallest rectangle that contains the entire portion of the target element which is currently visible within the intersection root.
IntersectionObserverEntryIntersectionRec.value: A which describes the part of the target element that's currently visible within the root's intersection rectangle.This rectangle is computed by taking the intersection of with each of the 's ancestors' clip rectangles, with the exception of the intersection itself.

IntersectionObserverEntryIsIntersecting.summary: The isIntersecting read-only property of the interface is a Boolean value which is true if the target element intersects with the intersection observer's root.

remarks.para: If this is true, then, the IntersectionObserverEntry describes a transition into a state of intersection; if it's false, then you know the transition is from intersecting to not-intersecting.

IntersectionObserverEntryIsIntersecting.value: A Boolean value which indicates whether the element has transitioned into a state of intersection (true) or out of a state of intersection (false).
